correct_answer: The length of the day will vary in the course of the year.

question_text: Consider the following statements on magnetic variation:
options: The largest values of variation are found along the anti meridians of the Magnetic poles.
Variation will always increase when the total strength of the terrestrial magnetic field increases.
The variation is east when True North seems to be located west of Magnetic North.
correct_answer: The variation is east when True North seems to be located west of Magnetic North.

subject: General Navigation
question_text: The total Magnetic Force of the terrestrial magnetic field:
options: will be stronger at higher altitudes because the attenuation is less at high altitudes.
is strongest at the magnetic poles.
is horizontal in all positions on the surface of the Earth.
is vertical at the magnetic equator.
correct_answer: is strongest at the magnetic poles.

question_text: On a transverse Mercator chart, the scale is exactly correct along the:
options: meridian of tangency and the parallel of latitude perpendicular to it.

question_text: On a Transverse Mercator chart, scale is exactly correct along the:
options: datum meridian and meridian perpendicular to it.
Equator, parallel of origin and prime vertical.

subject: General Navigation
question_text: Scale on a Lamberts conformal chart is:
options: constant along a meridian of longitude.
constant along a parallel of latitude.
correct_answer: constant along a parallel of latitude.

question_text: An Oblique Mercator projection is used specifically to produce:
options: radio navigational charts in equatorial regions.
topographical maps of large east/ west extent.
charts of the great circle route between two points.
correct_answer: charts of the great circle route between two points.

radio navigation charts in equatorial areas.

options: in the area between the standard parallels.
